isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - ENGINE COOLANT LEVEL SYSTEM - SIGNAL FUNCTION

svcprocinfo.para: The purpose of the Engine Coolant Level monitoring system is to signal the driver in the event of a low coolant situation. Depending on the programming of the control module it is also capable of shutting off the engine to prevent damage to the engine due to low coolant level.

svcsubproc.title: Coolant Level Sensor
svcsubproc.para: There are two types of coolant level sensors:
The magnetic switch type sensor is used and located in plastic surge tanks. The magnetic switch will be open when the coolant level in the tank is full.
The conductive probe type sensor is used and located in steel surge tanks. The conductive probe is grounded when the coolant level in the tank is full.
